alert.note: Alert for Eastern Culberson County; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:19PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Culberson County through 500 PM CDT... At 419 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles north of Plateau, or 19 miles northeast of Van Horn, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Culberson County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Texas.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Culberson County; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor
